with the leaves reduced to scales
with branches in the axils of the lower leaves
restricted to the bases of the stem

subulate and spinescent after shedding of the head
nodding in bud and at fruiting
at flowering clearly differentiated in imbricate short outer bracts and a row of subequal inner bracts
at flowering fully imbricate, with outer bracts gradually approaching the inner ones in length
at flowering clearly differentiated in few short outer bracts and a row of subequal inner bracts
with large ovate outer bracts in one row equalling the inner ones in length and with a third row of tiny bracts in between
uniseriate, with only one row of inner bracts
uniseriate, with only one row of inner bracts connate at their base
yellow, tinged coppery-red on lower surface
yellow, tinged greyish on lower surface
bicolourous, basal part of ligule and other part of tube blackish-red or blackish-brown, remainder yellow

with two thick lateral main ribs
with five secondary ribs in between
ending in a distinct apical disk
of the same colour as the corpus
with five secondary ribs in between

Arbre secondaire Xper2 : groupes et variables contenues dans ces groupes
Lactuca viminea (L.) J. Presl & C. Presl

Categorical.Note: with long-decurrent auricles adnate to the stem
with many glabrous or glandular branches
with an apical corona of small scales
except for the spinulose margins and undersurface of midrib
with projecting blunt or acute auricles

Representation.Label: Lactuca cyprica (Rech. f.) N. Kilian & Greuter

Categorical.Note: except in the region of the synflorescence
with acute or rounded, entire or dentate auricles
with the lateral heads in dense clusters
with oblong or obovate, erose-laciniate scales
with the heads terminal or in groups of 2-4-(-8) in the axils of upper leaves
, lateral or in the axils of the branches, rarely terminal
with 2 narrow, longitudinal dorsal wings and a broader ventral wing
, becoming indurated and incurved in fruit, enveloping the outer achenes
, the outer achenes a little longer than the inner ones, with a shorter pappus
, remaining enveloped in the persistant inner involucral bracts
with fragile pinnules distinctly flattened and shortly connate at base
, partly enveloped by the persistent inner involucral bracts
of lacerate, yellowish scales about 0.8 mm long
, somewhat dilated into a scaly base
with 2-barbed bristles with some sparse woolly hairs
with 2-4(-5)-barbed bristles intermixed with a much shorter indumentum
above, but abruptly constricted at apex in fruit
with very unequal, sharply spinose lobes
, the heads sessile in the axils of the uppermost leaves
almost totally enveloping the achenes and forming membranous-margined lateral wings
almost totally enveloping the achenes and winged all round
with acute or obtuse, entire or denticulate auricles
, sometimes divided into very narrow almost filiform lobes
with projecting blunt or acute auricles
, the inner flowers often purple, usually turning greenish when dry
, occasionally with an additonal long bristle
with 3-4 long bristles and some scales in a row at their base
, the outer series thicker than the inner
with acute or rounded projecting auricles
, often with a dark violet margin
with a rosette of leaves in the first year
with short or long acuminate auricles
, partly enveloped by the persistent inner involucral bracts
, enveloped by the persistent inner involucral bracts
with the outer achenes sometimes absent or replaced by typical inner achenes
with a winged usually reddish-purple petiole
, half enclosed in the inner involucral bracts
in older plants, forming a dense obconical clump topped by a mass of flower heads
with prominent transverse septa simulating minute protuberances
